page.title: 06Motte and Bailey,Brinklow.
page.content: Brinklow's ancient mound is thought to be older than Roman times and was probably some kind of fortification before 1066.A castle was built here in the 12th.century by{Roger de Mowbray with a wooden stockade circling the keep and surrounded by earthworks which survive to this day. Sometimes called the{"Tump"}it is a well known landmark and is a popular place for recreation.It also serves the village school as a place for environmental studies.Other schools use these hills and during the summer many parties of children of all ages take advantage of the rich local history. Access to the site has been made easier recently by a lay-by,stile and flight of steps.Climbers are rewarded by fine view as it is the highest point around.
